para.p: We prove that if the paths of a stochastic process are left-continuous then the stochastic process is jointly measurable. 1 1 footnote 1 cf. Charalambos D. Aliprantis and Kim C. Border, Infinite Dimensional Analysis: A Hitchhiker’s Guide, third ed., p. 153, Lemma 4.51.

If
X

E

X
are left-continuous, then
X
is jointly measurable.

We now prove that if a stochastic process is adapted and left-continuous then it is progressively measurable. 4 4 footnote 4 cf. Daniel W. Stroock, Probability Theory: An Analytic View, second ed., p. 267, Lemma 7.1.2.

F t

X
is progressively measurable with respect to this filtration.
